nodes.documentation:
@notice Allow player to add ETH balance to his/her account.
 Minimun amount to add = 0.1 Ether.
 Player may not increase bet while waiting for Oracle response.
 Balance to be added to be determined by transaction value.
 Updated balance will be shown to user in browser.*
nodes.name: placeBet

nodes.documentation:
@notice Issues query to Oracle for a random number.
User must pay the gas fee and bet atleast 0.1 ether.
User cannot make another Oracle request while awaiting another query.
player balance to bet must not exceed half the size of the available pot.*
nodes.name: startFlipCoin
resolveFlip
payOut

@notice Getter function for player's current ether balance.
@return returns the current balance bet by the player.*

nodes.documentation: @notice Admin function to add claimable ether balance to the contract.*

removePot

nodes.documentation:
@notice Admin function to unlock player funds in case of Oracle failure.
To be used in case of emergency funds recovery.*
nodes.name: unlockPlayer

nodes.documentation:
@notice Issues query to Oracle for a random number.
User must pay the gas fee and bet atleast 0.1 ether.
User cannot make another Oracle request while awaiting another query.
player balance to bet must not exceed half the size of the available pot.*
nodes.name: startFlipCoin
resolveFlip
payOut

nodes.documentation:
@notice Getter function for player's current ether balance.
@return returns the current balance bet by the player.*
nodes.name: getBalance

nodes.documentation: @notice Getter function to obtain current balance of contract.*
nodes.name: getPot

nodes.documentation: @notice Getter function to obtain current balance of contract claimable by players.*
nodes.name: getCommitedPot

nodes.documentation: @notice Admin function to add claimable ether balance to the contract.*
nodes.name: addPot
removePot

nodes.documentation:
@notice Admin function to unlock player funds in case of Oracle failure.
To be used in case of emergency funds recovery.*
nodes.name: unlockPlayer
__callback

__callback(bytes32,string).details: The following `__callback` functions are just placeholders ideally     meant to be defined in child contract when proofs are used.     The function bodies simply silence compiler warnings.

params._queryId: is used to determine player who called this query.
params._result: is random string generated by Oracle.

getBalance().return: returns the current balance bet by the player.*

params.amount: is ether value to be paid to player.*
is balance to be withdrawn from contract.*

__callback(bytes32,string,bytes).notice: Oracle call function returning a random string. Function hashes the string to produce pseudo-random number either 0 or 1.

addPot().notice: Admin function to add claimable ether balance to the contract.*

getBalance().notice: Getter function for player's current ether balance.

getCommitedPot().notice: Getter function to obtain current balance of contract claimable by players.*

getPot().notice: Getter function to obtain current balance of contract.*

payOut(uint256).notice: Allows player to withdraw their winnings from the contracts pot. Amount to be withdrawn must be less than or equal to the player's balance. Players may not withdraw bet while awaiting for Oracle query.

placeBet().notice: Allow player to add ETH balance to his/her account. Minimun amount to add = 0.1 Ether. Player may not increase bet while waiting for Oracle response. Balance to be added to be determined by transaction value. Updated balance will be shown to user in browser.*

removePot(uint256).notice: Admin function to remove specified available ether balance from the contract. Admin is not allowed to withdraw balance claimable by players.

startFlipCoin().notice: Issues query to Oracle for a random number. User must pay the gas fee and bet atleast 0.1 ether. User cannot make another Oracle request while awaiting another query. player balance to bet must not exceed half the size of the available pot.*

unlockPlayer(address).notice: Admin function to unlock player funds in case of Oracle failure. To be used in case of emergency funds recovery.*
